paragraphs.name: cad7
paragraphs.text: Not wanting a child is a tough decision to make. It alienates you from a large number of people. In reality it takes a strong person, man or woman, to admit that they don’t want something just because everyone else does. It also takes a strong person to make meaning in their own lives in ways others may not consider conventional. I’m forever grateful that I was brought into this world, mostly because I’m not sure what the other options were, but also because I like living life. I find meaning in life every day, have wonderful relationships and am with someone who has the same viewpoints as me. I also have only one cat. So I’m child-free and you don’t need to worry about me.

paragraphs.text: Yes, great post Ariel! I am publishing a post on my blog next week about why I don’t have kids. Spoiler: I don’t have them because I don’t want them. Just keep being honest and the questions will stop eventually.

paragraphs.name: 69b6
paragraphs.text: Check out the https://twitter.com/marriedwokids podcast. It’s great. There is a childfree community out there I just discovered and I love it. You are not alone!

b4a257259ac3.title: We tried for years to have kids, but could not.

paragraphs.name: dfa8
paragraphs.text: We tried for years to have kids, but could not. Now we try to find real reasons why life without offspring can be full, complete, even fun. The problem is most of the planet has not matured to the point where childlessness is the norm. I hope that changes.

48fec3c4240e.title: I love the title of this post.

paragraphs.name: 90af
paragraphs.text: I love the title of this post. I’ve heard this far too often when I sheepishly admit to people that I don’t want children. The judgement is just too much!

paragraphs.name: 758c
paragraphs.text: Yeah, I’m 56, childless and fine. Don’t even worry about it. My friends all have kids. I adore their kids. Best of all, I enjoy leaving their house and their kids, husbands, parents, friends and whoevs… and going back home to my own private world, sans children.

virtuals.subtitle: It took me many years to figure out why people did not understand my feelings about not wanting children and questioned me on them…

paragraphs.name: a705
paragraphs.text: Welcome to the fray! I am in my mid-forties and thankfully I have survived and remained astonishingly child-free for all of this time.

paragraphs.name: c1f3
paragraphs.text: It took me many years to figure out why people did not understand my feelings about not wanting children and questioned me on them regularly. For many people the urge to procreate is primal…

virtuals.subtitle: I was never super opposed to it, but parenthood was not a driving need for me. I figured if I wound up with a guy who wanted kids badly…

paragraphs.text: It’s funny how men seldom get this question.

paragraphs.name: 9ddd
paragraphs.text: I was never super opposed to it, but parenthood was not a driving need for me. I figured if I wound up with a guy who wanted kids badly enough, I would do the breadwinner thing and he could stay home and raise them. No gentleman was ever interested in this deal, so I skipped it.

virtuals.subtitle: Sometimes I feel people poke you because it makes them uncomfortable to see someone else having the courage to speak out and act while they…

content.subtitle: Sometimes I feel people poke you because it makes them uncomfortable to see someone else having the courage to speak out and act while they…

paragraphs.name: fb25
paragraphs.text: Very well explained. People need to learn to respect other’s choices. And I don’t get why is that so hard at the first place? Until you have a kid, everybody is ready for moral policing, yet once the kid is there-’oh we told you parenting is difficult’!

508b5a4ef0f2.title: I’m in my forties, and though people have stopped asking, the judgement has not stopped, in fact in…

paragraphs.name: bb00
paragraphs.text: I’m in my forties, and though people have stopped asking, the judgement has not stopped, in fact in some ways, it has gotten worse. I’ve received judgmental comments from friends with children about the fact that my partner and I use our disposable income to travel, or buy bikes (something we love to do), we also chose to live in a very small home…

paragraphs.name: 18c8
paragraphs.text: Thank you I really appreciate the response! It’s unfair that people assume they understand your situation, or the reason why you chose a childfree lifestyle. I agree that it’s extremely irritating to have someone assume they have a right to your private information. Especially if they think they know you better than yourself!

paragraphs.name: d8e2

paragraphs.text: I know a woman who had said she thought she wanted children, but hasn’t found the right partner to have one with. Now she wonders if it’s about the partner, or maybe she never wanted them in the first place. And regardless, it’s her choice, which is the beautiful part!

fabfe19d78bf.title: Lesbians have the opposite problem — no one expects us to have children!

paragraphs.name: 51dd
paragraphs.text: Lesbians have the opposite problem — no one expects us to have children! And the ‘but no father: are you trying to make your boys gay?’ objection is not uncommon.

482510105801.title: I know someone is going to be upset about this, but I feel tons of maternal instinct for my cat!

paragraphs.name: 6dd1
paragraphs.text: I know someone is going to be upset about this, but I feel tons of maternal instinct for my cat! Ha. I’ve just never had it for children. It’s beautiful to see parents interact with their children, well sometimes. But I’ve never had that moment either. I actually feel kind of awkward around children. Thank you for the kind words and taking the time to read my piece!

virtuals.subtitle: Many people seem convinced from childhood with the certainty that they want kids, will have them, and that life would be hopeless and bleak…

42c6351f29e5.title: Good for you! And you’re right — you won’t change your mind. (I speak from experience).

content.subtitle: Many people seem convinced from childhood with the certainty that they want kids, will have them, and that life would be hopeless and bleak…

paragraphs.name: 42ed
paragraphs.text: Good for you! And you’re right — you won’t change your mind. (I speak from experience).

paragraphs.name: b8ca
paragraphs.text: Many people seem convinced from childhood with the certainty that they want kids, will have them, and that life would be hopeless and bleak without them. I truly do hope they have those children, because they’re who SHOULD have them…

paragraphs.name: f2a4
paragraphs.text: I am exactly the same. I’ve never wanted children — first people told me that I would change my mind when I was twenty five, then they said it would happen when I was thirty… still waiting for that lightning bolt of maternal instinct! It can be a lonely position to hold when everybody around you is having babies and not understanding why you aren’t — a loneliness that you have articulated perfectly, thank you.

paragraphs.name: 50c9
paragraphs.text: I made it to 49 with no kids and no regrets. Then I adopted a runaway teen — one of those out-of-the-blue, fell-from-the-sky situations. I don’t regret adopting her. She, and later her two children, have added richness and heartache to my life and have also greatly depleted my bank account and resulted in me working 50–60 hours a week at a time in…

paragraphs.text: I’m 39 years old and childless. And yes, I do have a cat. And yes, some people don’t say it, but they take me for a crazy, selfish, or a poor thing that wasn’t able to get a man…And I do think that most of the people are parents without really willing for that, only to fit on the long list that society give to every induvidual. Or to have some one to…

paragraphs.name: 4b79
paragraphs.text: Congratulations on knowing who you are, and not being afraid to be that person. I’ve known since I was a child I didn’t want to have children. Now 53, and I never changed my mind, no matter who tried to convince me otherwise. I got into the habit, when people asked me why, I would ask them, why do you WANT to have children? Can you provide an…
